S. Korean Lawmaker on Hunger Strike
articles.content:
S. Korean Lawmaker on Hunger Strike 
    Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- Kwon Yong Gil, member of the National Assembly from the Democratic Workers' Party (DWP) of south Korea, entered into an indefinite hunger strike on Nov. 29 in protest against the police's breaking into his office room and the unjust labor policy of the government, according to MBC of south Korea.    
 He accused the government of intensifying the suppression of the workers on the charge of waging a labor movement for the right to existence. 
 On Nov. 30 he sent an appeal to the members of the DWP in which he branded the government's consistent exclusion and disregard of the DWP as an all-out attack on the labor movement and a sinister attempt to eliminate the progressive politics in this land.

News Conference on Polish National Day
articles.content:
News Conference on Polish National Day 
    Pyongyang, December 3 (KCNA) -- Wojciech Kaluza, Polish ambassador to the DPRK, Thursday called a news conference at the Taedonggang Club for the Diplomatic Corps on the occasion of the national day of Poland.
 Present there were media persons in Pyongyang.    
 The ambassador referred to the political situation and external policy of Poland and the development of its relations with the DPRK.
